scriptmanager.scripts.Read_Analysis

Class ScalingFactor

  • java.lang.Object
    • scriptmanager.scripts.Read_Analysis.ScalingFactor

  • public class ScalingFactor
extends java.lang.Object
    The script class for calculating various kinds of normalization factors from a BAM file. Used to normalize for various kinds of analysis.
    NCIS code adapted from Mahony Lab https://github.com/seqcode/seqcode-core
    NCIS algorithm from Liang & Keles (BMC Bioinformatics 2012)
    See Also:
    ScalingFactorCLI, ScalingFactorOutput, ScalingFactorWindow

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ScalingFactor.PairedCounts
      Simple class for storing paired counts that are sortable in first dimension

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScalingFactor

        public ScalingFactor(java.io.File bamFile,
                     java.io.File bl,
                     java.io.File c,
                     java.lang.String out_basename,
                     boolean out,
                     int scale,
                     int win,
                     double min)
        Initialize scaling factor parameters in this constructor
        Parameters:
        bamFile - the BAM file to calculate a scaling factor from
        bl - the BED formatted blacklist file for excluding specific regions from the calculation
        c - the control BAM file that is used by the NCIS strategy to determine background signal
        out_basename - the filepath base name (the script will append suffixes) for the output files
        out - whether or not to write the output (write =true, don't write = false)
        scale - an integer value encoding the scaling type strategy to use (1=Total Tag, 2=NCIS, 3=NCISwithTotal)
        win - the NCIS parameter for the window/bin size (only used if scale!=1)
        min - the NCIS parameter for the minimum fraction (only used if scale!=1)

      • scalingRatioByNCIS

        public double scalingRatioByNCIS(java.util.List<java.lang.Float> setA,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.Float> setB,
                                 java.lang.String outpath,
                                 java.lang.String fileid,
                                 double minFrac)
        Find the scaling ratio according to the NCIS method from Liang & Keles (BMC Bioinf 2012). Also sets a background proportion estimate for the signal channel. Should be run using *all* genomic windows in the Lists. Uses ratios that are based on at least 75% of genomic regions by default.
        Parameters:
        setA - signal list
        setB - control list
        outpath - optional file that will contain the data
        fileid -
        minFrac -
        Returns:

      • scalingRatioByHitRatioAndNCIS

        public double scalingRatioByHitRatioAndNCIS(java.util.List<java.lang.Float> setA,
                                            java.util.List<java.lang.Float> setB,
                                            double totalA,
                                            double totalB,
                                            java.lang.String outpath,
                                            java.lang.String fileid,
                                            double minFrac)
        Find the scaling ratio according to the total tag normalization followed by NCIS method from Liang & Keles (BMC Bioinf 2012). Also sets a background proportion estimate for the signal channel. Should be run using *all* genomic windows in the Lists. Uses ratios that are based on at least 75% of genomic regions by default.
        Parameters:
        setA - signal list
        setB - control list
        totalA -
        totalB -
        outpath - optional file that will contain the data
        fileid -
        minFrac -
        Returns:
